page.title: 14BONCHURCH CHURCHES.
page.content: Bonchurch has two churches both dedicated to St. Boniface. The small Eleventh Century church is used for candlelight services in the summer. The Parish church was completed in 1849 and built by Day and Jolliffe of Bonchurch. The winter congregation consists of 50 people. The Rector is the Reverend Alfred Tedman who is also Vicar of Wroxall. Ian Snow is the organist. Family Communion takes place at 11 am. on Sunday. The Alternative Service Book is used. About 10 children meet on Wednesday afternoons for instruction and tea. There is a memorial to Admiral Jellicoe in the Church. Algernon Swinburne and H.de Vere Stacpoole are buried in the churchyard. There is a Church Hall which was originally the National School.
